\textbf{Problem}: Evaluate: $\left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} \right) \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right)$\newline


\textbf{Manual Solution}: For any $x$ and $y$, $(x+y)(x-y)=x^2-y^2+xy-xy=x^2-y^2$, so \begin{align*}
\left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} \right) \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right)&=\left(\frac12\right)^2-\left(\frac13\right)^2\\
&=\frac14-\frac19\\
&=\frac{9}{36}-\frac{4}{36}\\
&=\boxed{\frac{5}{36}}
\end{align*}\newline


\textbf{Chatgpt Solution}: Using the difference of squares factorization $a^2-b^2 = (a+b)(a-b)$, we get \begin{align*}
\left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} \right) \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right) &= \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{3} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} - \frac{1}{6} + \frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{9} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} - \frac{1}{9} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{5}{36}}.
\end{align*}\newline

\textbf{Llama 2 (fine-tuned with chatgpt labels) Solution}: we have that $\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3}{2} = \frac{3}{4}$ and $\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3}{2} - \frac{1}{3} = \frac{3}{4} - \frac{1}{3} = \frac{1}{4}$. therefore, $\left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} \right) \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right) = \left( \frac{3}{4} \right) \left( \frac{1}{4} \right) = \boxed{\frac{3}{4}}$.
